meanings.sent1: She held the middie spot on the team, neither the best nor the worst.
meanings.sent2: The middie of the sandwich was filled with cheese and tomatoes.
meanings.sent3: In the game of musical chairs, the middie always had a tough time deciding where to sit.
meanings.sent4: The middie of the rainbow seemed to glow brighter than the rest of the colors.
meanings.sent5: The middie of the road was the safest place to walk.

meanings.sent1: The young middie was eager to learn about life at sea.
meanings.sent2: The middie saluted the captain as he passed by.
meanings.sent3: The middie accidentally dropped his hat overboard and had to fish it out.
meanings.sent4: The middie's enthusiasm for sailing was contagious among the crew.
meanings.sent5: The middie's uniform was crisp and neat for the ceremony.

meanings.sent1: The shiny buttons on the middie caught the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She carefully pressed the middie before the inspection.
meanings.sent3: The middie was too tight around the waist after the holiday feasting.
meanings.sent4: The middie's collar was adorned with intricate embroidery.
meanings.sent5: The middie's hat completed the official look of the uniform.
